intro: Gaudichaudia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is a low-growing shrub with hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gaudichaudia humilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
